specialRules.title: Void Shields
description: Each void shield will automatically stop one point of damage and then go down. Do not make armour saves for damage stopped by void shields, nor allocate Blast markers. Once all of the shields have been knocked down, the Titan may be damaged normally and you may make saving throws against any hits that are scored. Hits from close combat ignore void shields but units using their firefight values must first knock down any shields before they can damage the Titan.

Void shields that have been knocked down can be repaired. Each Titan can repair one downed void shield in the end phase of each turn. In addition, if a Titan regroups it can use the dice roll to either repair the void shield or remove Blast markers (e.g., if you rolled a 2 you could repair 2 shields, remove 2 Blast markers or repair 1 shield and remove 1 Blast marker).

specialRules.title: Daemon Engine (x)
description: Formations completely made up of units with the Daemon Engine (x) special rule, and that have the same faction within its brackets, gain the bonus associated with that faction:
Slaanesh: Formation gains +1 to activate when attempting to Double.
Nurgle: Formation gains +1 to activate when attempting to Marshal.
Khorne: Formation gains +1 to activate when attempting to Engage.
Tzeench: Formation gains +1 to activate when attempting to Advance.
Chaos Undivided: Formations ignores the -1 modifier for enemy formations within 30cm when rallying.

specialRules.title: Knight Units (AV-K)
description: Units with the unit type AV-K can take 2 damage before they are killed, and counts as 2 units for Outnumber, Blast Markers, number of attacks in an assault, hit allocation and the maximum number of units in base contact. They are treated like normal Armoured Vehicles in all other respects.

unit.name: Decimator
unit.notes: Critical Hit Effect: The Decimator is destroyed.

unit.name: Questor
unit.notes: May step over units and pieces of terrain that that are lower lower than the unit’s knees and less than 2cm wide. Critical Hit Effect: The unit takes a point of damage and is moved D6cm in a random direction. If this move takes the Questor into impassable terrain or another unit it can’t move over then it stops immediately and is destroyed. All units it moves into or over suffer a hit on a roll of 6+.

unit.name: Subjugator
unit.notes: May step over units and pieces of terrain that that are lower lower than the unit’s knees and less than 2cm wide. Critical Hit Effect: The unit takes a point of damage and is moved D6cm in a random direction. If this move takes the Subjugator into impassable terrain or another unit it can’t move over then it stops immediately and is destroyed. All units it moves into or over suffer a hit on a roll of 6+.

unit.name: Deathwheel
unit.notes: Critical Hit Effect: Move the Deathwheel 3D6 in a random direction. If it moves into impassable terrain or a war engine unit it will stop. All units it moves into or over suffer a hit. The Deathwheel is then destroyed

unit.name: Plague Tower
unit.notes: May transport fourteen infantry units, Blight Drones or Dreadnoughts. Terminator units, Daemon Princes, Blight Drones and Dreadnoughts count as two units each. Critical Hit Effect: The Plague Tower takes 1 additional point of damage. 1D3 random units carried inside takes 1 hit.
